tests.name: 2023 USDF Introductory Level – Test A

suggested_ride_time.note: Suggested to add at least 2 min. for scheduling purposes

tests.purpose: To introduce the rider and/or horse to the sport of dressage, confirming that they are beginning to develop an understanding of correct dressage basics. The horse should be ridden freely forward in a steady tempo and clear rhythm, accepting contact with the bit. An understanding of test accuracy and geometry should be demonstrated.

instructions.all_trot: All trot work to be ridden rising
instructions.transitions: Transitions from walk to trot and trot to walk should be performed through medium walk with the objective of performing a smooth, progressive transition
instructions.turns: Turns from centerline to the track or from the track to centerline should be ridden as quarter circles touching the track at a point halfway between the centerline and the corner, and should be ridden smoothly

tests.comment: Horses should be ridden with steady, elastic contact, with the exception of the free walk where the horse is allowed complete freedom to stretch the neck forward and downward

movements.description: Enter, working trot rising. Medium walk
movements.directives: Regularity, quality of trot; straightness, willing, calm transition. Regularity, quality, of walk
Bend and balance; willing, calm transition

movements.description: Circle right 20 meters, working trot rising
movements.directives: Regularity; shape and size of circle; bend; balance
Regularity of trot; straightness; bend and balance in corner

movements.description: Circle left 20 meters, working trot rising
movements.directives: Regularity; shape and size of circle; bend; balance
Willing, calm transition; regularity, quality
Regularity, reach and ground cover with over track of free walk allowing complete freedom to stretch the neck forward and downward
Regularity, quality, willing, calm transition, bend and balance in turn. Straightness on centerline.
Straightness; attentiveness; immobility (min. 3 seconds)
movements.remarks: Leave arena in free walk. Exit at A.

collective_marks.description: freedom and regularity
desire to move forward with suppleness of the back and steady tempo
acceptance of steady contact, attention, and confidence
keeping in balance with horse
correct bend and preparation of transitions
correct size and shape of circles and turns
